meanings.definition: Any of a group of hormones, such as epinephrine and dopamine, that are produced by the adrenal glands and have various physiological effects.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that catecholamines like epinephrine can affect our body's functions.
meanings.sent2: Epinephrine is a catecholamine that can increase heart rate in times of stress.
meanings.sent3: I heard that too much catecholamine can turn you into a superhero!
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like a surge of catecholamine, propelling her forward with unstoppable force.
meanings.sent5: The rush of catecholamine made the experience unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A neurotransmitter, such as norepinephrine, that is involved in the transmission of nerve impulses.
meanings.sent1: Norepinephrine is a catecholamine that helps send messages between nerve cells.
meanings.sent2: The catecholamine norepinephrine plays a crucial role in our brain's communication system.
meanings.sent3: The little neurotransmitter catecholamine was always the life of the party in the brain!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts raced like a runaway catecholamine, firing off signals in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The catecholamine danced through the synapses, lighting up the brain with activity.
